intro: Piptocarpha senescens, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small, yellow to tan flowers that bloom in late summer. It is adapted to hot, dry climates and has deep roots that allow it to survive in poor soil conditions. Piptocarpha senescens plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
